page.title: 17WILD LIFE.
page.content: Many wild animals can be seen at the country park. This is especially so if you can walk through the park in the early morning or as dusk is falling. Badgers have several setts throughout the park and one is near the old lime workings in box A.Here the young badgers can be seen playing. Foxes live in many of the old badger setts. They are protected within the park as the Linlithgowshire hunt is not allowed to hunt within the boundary of Beecraigs. There is a grey squirrel colony very near the field archery. The dreys can be seen and the cones which the animals have gnawed lie scattered on the ground. Mallard,coots and herons are to be seen at the loch. In summer bright blue damsel flies are plentiful.
